title.narrative: Preparation of Feasibility Study & Business Plan for Piloting Integrated Agro-Food Parks (IAFP) in Ethiopia

description.narrative: Ethiopia has high potential for agricultural-led economic growth. However, its Agro-Industrial development is still in its infancy. At the production level, output is hindered by low-input, low value-added, limited marketing infrastructure and subsistence-oriented practices. At the processing level, most food processors operate well below capacity # many operate at less than 60 percent # and their products often to have difficulties complying with international quality standards. In response to the current situation, the Government of Ethiopia requested UNIDO to assist in the development of its Agro-Industrial sector. UNIDO agreed to develop a business plan for an Integrated Agro-Food Park (IAFP). An Integrated Agro-Food Park (IAFP) is a cluster of independent firms grouped together to share infrastructure, (i.e., roads, power, communication, etc.) and to exploit the opportunities for joint buying, selling, training, extension services and other synergies which can arise from shared efforts. The concentration of activities and services in one area is expected to facilitate economies of scale for the transformation of agricultural products for export or further commercialization.
